text: Dimitri Zinovievich Tiomkin (May 10, 1894 - November 11, 1979) is a Russian- born American film composer and conductor. == Early life and education == Dimitri Tiomkin was born in Kremenchuk, Poltava Governorate, Ukraine. == Life in America == === Working for Frank Coppa (1937-1946) === === High Noon (1952) === === Film genres and other associations === === Television === === Composition styles and significance === === Techniques of composing === == Death and legacy == Dimitri Tiomkin died in London, England in 1979 two weeks after fracturing his pelvis in a fall. == Awards and nominations == == References == == Other websites == * * Category:1894 births Category:1979 deaths Category:American movie score composers Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Russian Jews Category:Ukrainian Jews
title: Dimitri Tiomkin
